meanings.definition: Showing or expressing lack of pity or compassion.
meanings.sent1: The dispiteous man ignored the homeless person asking for help.
meanings.sent2: Her dispiteous attitude towards animals made her unpopular among her friends.
meanings.sent3: The dispiteous cat refused to share its toy with the playful kitten.
meanings.sent4: The dispiteous storm showed no mercy as it destroyed the fragile crops.
meanings.sent5: The dispiteous judge sentenced the young thief to a harsh punishment.

meanings.sent1: The dispiteous bully made fun of the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: His dispiteous remarks left her feeling hurt and upset.
meanings.sent3: The dispiteous prank caused laughter among his friends but embarrassment for the victim.
meanings.sent4: The dispiteous winter wind howled through the empty streets, chilling everyone to the bone.
meanings.sent5: The dispiteous queen ordered the execution of anyone who dared to oppose her rule.

meanings.sent1: The dispiteous dictator showed no mercy towards those who opposed him.
meanings.sent2: Her dispiteous response to the plea for help shocked everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The dispiteous teacher refused to give the students extra time to complete the test.
meanings.sent4: The dispiteous river flooded the town, washing away homes and livelihoods.
meanings.sent5: The dispiteous landlord evicted the struggling family without any warning.
